title: Classic Trivia Challenge - Question Pool
description: A diverse pool of trivia questions that randomly generates different game boards each time

questions.question: This city is the capital of France and home to the Eiffel Tower.
The capital of Japan, this city hosted the 2020 Summer Olympics.
This Australian capital was specially designed and built to be the seat of government.
This South American capital sits at over 11,000 feet above sea level.
The capital of this landlocked African country shares its name with the country itself.
This European capital was once divided by a famous wall.
The world's highest capital city, this South American city sits at 12,000 feet.
"May the Force be with you" is from this space opera franchise.
"Here's looking at you, kid" was famously said in this 1942 classic.
"I'll be back" was Arnold Schwarzenegger's catchphrase in this 1984 sci-fi film.
"Nobody puts Baby in a corner" comes from this 1987 dance romance.
"Frankly, my dear, I don't give a damn" concludes this 1939 Civil War epic.
questions.answer: What is Gone with the Wind?

questions.question: "You can't handle the truth!" was shouted by Jack Nicholson in this military courtroom drama.
questions.answer: What is A Few Good Men?

questions.question: This gas makes up about 78% of Earth's atmosphere.
The hardest natural substance on Earth, it's formed from carbon under extreme pressure.
This scientist developed the theory of evolution by natural selection.
The study of earthquakes is known by this term.
This element has the chemical symbol 'Au' and atomic number 79.
The powerhouse of the cell, this organelle produces ATP.
This sport is known as 'the beautiful game' and is played with feet.
Michael Jordan famously wore this jersey number during most of his NBA career.
This tennis tournament is played on grass courts in England each summer.
The maximum score possible in ten-pin bowling.
This country has won the most FIFA World Cup tournaments.
In golf, this term describes scoring one stroke under par.
This Italian dish consists of flat pasta sheets layered with sauce and cheese.
This spice, derived from crocus flowers, is one of the world's most expensive.
This Japanese dish features raw fish served over seasoned rice.
The process of browning sugar to create a sweet, nutty flavor.
This French cooking technique involves cooking food slowly in its own fat.
This fermented Korean dish is made primarily from cabbage and chili peppers.
This company created the iPhone and is known for its bitten apple logo.
HTML stands for HyperText this Language.
This programming language was created by Guido van Rossum and named after a comedy troupe.
The 'www' in website addresses stands for World Wide this.
This computer science pioneer is often called the first computer programmer.
This social media platform was originally called 'The Facebook'.
This ship sank on its maiden voyage in 1912 after hitting an iceberg.
This wall in Germany was torn down in 1989, symbolizing the end of the Cold War.
This Egyptian queen was the last pharaoh of Egypt and had relationships with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony.
This 1969 event saw humans first set foot on the moon.
This ancient wonder of the world was located in Alexandria and contained countless scrolls.
questions.answer: What is the Library of Alexandria?

questions.question: This Shakespeare play features the characters Romeo and Juliet.
This British author wrote the Harry Potter series.
This novel by Harper Lee deals with racial injustice in the American South.
questions.answer: What is To Kill a Mockingbird?

questions.question: This dystopian novel by George Orwell introduced the concept of 'Big Brother'.
This epic poem by Homer tells the story of Odysseus's journey home after the Trojan War.

final_jeopardy.question: This 1803 land acquisition from France doubled the size of the United States.
